employ.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to pay someone to work for you
employ.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Kelly is employed as a mechanic.
We have been employed to look at ways of reducing waste.
employ.translation[0].definitions[0].not: In everyday English, people usually say give someone a job rather than employ someone, and have a job rather than be employed:
They gave him a job delivering furniture.
He has a job at the factory.
employ.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to use a particular object, method, skill etc in order to achieve something
employ.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
employ.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to spend your time doing a particular thing
employ.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
employ.translation[0].definitions[2].not: Employ is usually passive in this meaning
employ.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to pay someone to work for you
employ.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: He is employed as a baggage handler at the airport.
We have employed consultants to look at ways of reducing waste.
